laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Testing for Influenza, Parainfluenza, Adenovirus, and Respiratory Syncytial Virus
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Positive for influenza A virus antigen (H1N1 presumed) at 7.5 months; Positive for respiratory syncytial virus at 9 months.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Mildly increased lung volumes, bilateral perihilar interstitial opacities, peribronchial cuffing.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Hyperinflated lungs, with peribronchial thickening noted at subsequent admission (11 days later).

laboratory_examinations.findings: Bilateral, symmetric paramedias -ntal ground-glass opacities, with scattered regions of air trapping, areas of atelectasis in dependent portions of the lungs, and a few small parenchymal nodules.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Chest radiographs taken 2 weeks later showed hyperinflated lungs and increasing perihilar patchy opacities in the right lung.
